sage.display

Interface IDisplaySystem

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DisplaySystem

    public interface IDisplaySystem
    IDisplaySystem defines the methods implemented by a display system. Every display system includes physical parameters such as width and height; displays also require an IRenderer which knows how to draw SceneNodes on the display.
    Author:
    John Clevenger

    • Method Detail

      • getWidth

        int getWidth()
        Returns the current width of the window in pixels. Note that the window width is not (necessarily) the same as the width of the canvas on which a IRenderer draws; see getRenderer() and IRenderer.getCanvas().
        Returns:
        Window width

      • getHeight

        int getHeight()
        Returns the current height of the window in pixels Note that the window height is not (necessarily) the same as the height of the canvas on which a IRenderer draws; see getRenderer() and IRenderer.getCanvas().
        Returns:
        Window height

        Returns the refresh rate of the display
        Returns:
        Display refresh rate

      • setWidth

        void setWidth(int width)
        Sets the pixel width of the window to a new value. Ignored if the window is full-screen.
        Parameters:
        width - -- the new width of the window

      • setHeight

        void setHeight(int height)
        Sets the pixel height of the window to a new value. Ignored if the window is full-screen.
        Parameters:
        height - -- the new window height

      • setBitDepth

        void setBitDepth(int numBits)
        Sets the pixel depth of the window to a new value. Must be a value supported by the display hardware.
        Parameters:
        numBits - -- the new window bit-depth

      • setRefreshRate

        void setRefreshRate(int rate)
        Sets the display refresh rate. Must be a value supported by the display hardware.
        Parameters:
        rate - -- the new refresh rate

      • setTitle

        void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Sets a new title for the window title bar. Only effective if the window is not in full-screen mode.
        Parameters:
        title - -- the new title string

      • getRenderer

        IRenderer getRenderer()
        Returns the IRenderer currently associated with this IDisplay.
        Returns:
        the display's renderer

      • close

        void close()
        Close the window, releasing any resources associated with the display. If the window was running in full-screen mode, the display is restored to windowed-mode.

      • isCreated

        boolean isCreated()
        Returns a flag indicating whether or not the IDisplaySystem object has been fully constructed and is ready for use. Note that simply returning from invoking an IDisplaySystem constructor does not insure that display creation is complete; some operations may have been spawned onto separate threads. Specifically, IDisplaySystem creation is typically done on a separate thread; implementations of this method should verify that both the IDisplaySystem construction is complete AND that the underlying IRenderer has been realized (as determined by invoking IRenderer.isRealized()) before returning true. Application code should check the return value from this method before using an IDisplaySystem for anything.
        Returns:
        -- a flag indicating whether or not the IDisplaySystem is fully created and ready for use

      • isFullScreen

        boolean isFullScreen()
        Returns a flag indicating whether or not the IDisplaySystem object is running in FSEM (Full-Screen Exclusive Mode) or not. Note that it is not required that an implementation of this interface provide mutators to set/change the current FSEM mode; it is allowable for an implementation to specify (and fix) the mode at construction time (via constructor parameters).
        Returns:
        -- true if the DisplaySystem is in full-screen mode; false otherwise

      • addKeyListener

        void addKeyListener(java.awt.event.KeyListener k)
        Adds a KeyListener to the canvas of the IRenderer associated with this IDisplaySystem.
        Parameters:
        k - -- the KeyListener to be added to the renderer's canvas

      • addMouseListener

        void addMouseListener(java.awt.event.MouseListener m)
        Adds a MouseListener to the canvas of the IRenderer associated with this IDisplaySystem.
        Parameters:
        m - -- the MouseListener to be added to the renderer's canvas

      • addMouseMotionListener

        Adds a MouseMotionListener to the canvas of the IRenderer associated with this IDisplaySystem.
        Parameters:

      • isShowing

        boolean isShowing()
        Returns a flag indicating whether the window associated with this IDisplaySystem is visible (showing on the screen)
        Returns:
        -- true if the window is showing on the screen

      • convertPointToScreen

        void convertPointToScreen(java.awt.Point p)
        Converts the specified Point from the coordinate system of the window used by the underlying IRenderer to screen coordinates.

      • setPredefinedCursor

        void setPredefinedCursor(int Cursor)
        Sets the mouse cursor on the window used by the IDisplaySystem to the predefined cursor represented by the specified integer. The integer must match one of the predefined fields in Cursor.
        See Also:
        Cursor

      • setCustomCursor

        void setCustomCursor(java.lang.String fileName)
        Sets the mouse cursor on the window used by the IDisplaySystem to the image in the specified file. The file must be one of the image file types supported by ImageIcon class. If filename is null or an empty String, the cursor is set to be invisible. The position of the cursor is initially set to (0,0).
        See Also:
        ImageIcon, Toolkit.createCustomCursor(Image, Point, String)
